variants.Description in input context: The PINK1 protein contains an N-terminal mitochondrial targeting domain and a serine/threonine protein kinase. Some recent studies localize the protein in the mitochondria, and probably with the kinase domain facing to the cytoplasm through its outer membrane.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Phylogenetic and in silico structural analysis

Material used.Description: The PINK1 gene comprises eight exons, which encode a ubiquitously expressed 581 amino acid protein that contains an N-terminal mitochondrial targeting domain and a serine/threonine protein kinase.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 protein structure was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Phylogenetic tree construction and protein structure prediction

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression greater than 80% in silico.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression less than 50% in silico.
